page.title: 03The Wild Area at Dinnington
page.content: Many schools are making Nature Areas in their school grounds, but there has been a {Wild Area}at{Dinnington}since 1973. It began with a campaign called "Plant a tree for 73" and has developed since then. Now the trees are well established, wild flowers, spring flowers, shrubs and grasses grow there. In 1985 the{Wild Area}is being extended, a marshy area and boulders for moss is planned. On Thursday 2nd May,1985 200 trees were planted to begin the extension. Mr.Creedy and the{COUNTRYSIDE {MANAGEMENT SERVICE}brought the trees and helped in planting by digging the holes. Every child in the school planted a tree.{THE COUNTRYSIDE {MANAGEMENT SERVICE} encourage and help people to conserve and improve their own environment. Ash, oak, blackthorn, hazel and hawthorn were planted.
